message.content:
Explore our SPLICE installation setup to understand:

1. How we structure our CEP plugin installation package (check installer/macos/ directory)
2. What files are included in our installer
3. How we build the .pkg file
4. What scripts we use (build-zxp.sh, sign-and-notarize.sh, etc.)
5. The directory structure of our splice-cep plugin
6. Our manifest and configuration files
7. The actual built packages in dist/

Focus on understanding our current installation package structure and build process.

content.content:
1→# SPLICE Installer Build Guide
     2→
     3→This document provides complete instructions for building the SPLICE installers for macOS and Windows.
     4→
     5→## Overview
     6→
     7→The SPLICE installer system creates native platform installers that provide a FireCut-style one-click installation experience:
     8→
     9→- **macOS**: Native `.pkg` installer built with `pkgbuild` and `productbuild`
    10→- **Windows**: `.exe` installer built with NSIS (Nullsoft Scriptable Install System)
    11→- **UXP Plugin**: `.ccx` package for Premiere Pro 25.0+
    12→
    13→## Directory Structure
    14→
    15→```
    16→installer/
    17→├── .github/
    18→│   └── workflows/
    19→│       └── build-installers.yml    # GitHub Actions CI/CD
    20→├── macos/
    21→│   ├── build-pkg.sh                # macOS build script
    22→│   ├── distribution.xml            # productbuild configuration
    23→│   ├── uninstall.sh               # Uninstaller script
    24→│   ├── resources/                  # Installer UI HTML files
    25→│   │   ├── welcome.html
    26→│   │   ├── readme.html
    27→│   │   ├── license.html
    28→│   │   └── conclusion.html
    29→│   └── scripts/
    30→│       ├── preinstall              # Pre-installation script
    31→│       └── postinstall             # Post-installation script
    32→├── windows/
    33→│   ├── splice-installer.nsi        # NSIS installer script
    34→│   └── build-exe.bat               # Windows build script
    35→├── scripts/
    36→│   ├── build-ccx.sh               # CCX packager (Unix)
    37→│   └── build-ccx.bat              # CCX packager (Windows)
    38→├── shared/
    39→│   ├── version.json               # Version configuration
    40→│   └── assets/
    41→│       ├── license.txt            # EULA
    42→│       ├── installer-icon.ico     # Windows installer icon
    43→│       └── ...                    # Other assets
    44→├── package.json                   # Node.js dependencies
    45→└── BUILD.md                       # This file
    46→```
    47→
    48→## Prerequisites
    49→
    50→### macOS Build Requirements
    51→
    52→- macOS 10.14 or later
    53→- Xcode Command Line Tools (`xcode-select --install`)
    54→- For signing: Apple Developer ID Installer certificate
    55→- For notarization: Apple Developer account with App-Specific Password
    56→
    57→### Windows Build Requirements
    58→
    59→- Windows 10 or later
    60→- [NSIS 3.x](https://nsis.sourceforge.io/Download) (add to PATH)
    61→- For signing: Code signing certificate (.pfx file)
    62→- Optional: [Windows SDK](https://developer.microsoft.com/windows/downloads/windows-sdk/) for `signtool`
    63→
    64→### Cross-Platform Requirements
    65→
    66→- Node.js 18+ and npm
    67→- Git
    68→- zip utility (included on macOS, use PowerShell on Windows)
    69→
    70→## Building the Installers
    71→
    72→### Quick Start (Local Build)
    73→
    74→```bash
    75→# Install dependencies
    76→cd installer
    77→npm install
    78→
    79→# Build macOS installer (on macOS)
    80→./macos/build-pkg.sh
    81→
    82→# Build Windows installer (on Windows)
    83→windows\build-exe.bat
    84→```
    85→
    86→### Building the CCX Package
    87→
    88→The CCX package is required for UXP plugin support (Premiere Pro 25+):
    89→
    90→```bash
    91→# On macOS/Linux
    92→./scripts/build-ccx.sh
    93→
    94→# On Windows
    95→scripts\build-ccx.bat
    96→```
    97→
    98→The CCX file will be created at `shared/splice-uxp.ccx`.
    99→
   100→### Building macOS Installer (Unsigned)
   101→
   102→```bash
   103→cd installer
   104→./macos/build-pkg.sh
   105→```
   106→
   107→Output: `dist/SPLICE-Installer-{version}.pkg`
   108→
   109→### Building macOS Installer (Signed + Notarized)
   110→
   111→```bash
   112→./macos/build-pkg.sh \
   113→  --sign "Developer ID Installer: Your Company (TEAM_ID)" \
   114→  --notarize \
   115→  --apple-id "your@email.com" \
   116→  --team-id "TEAM_ID" \
   117→  --password "app-specific-password"
   118→```
   119→
   120→Or using environment variables:
   121→
   122→```bash
   123→export SIGNING_IDENTITY="Developer ID Installer: Your Company (TEAM_ID)"
   124→export NOTARIZE=true
   125→export APPLE_ID="your@email.com"
   126→export TEAM_ID="TEAM_ID"
   127→export APP_PASSWORD="app-specific-password"
   128→
   129→./macos/build-pkg.sh
   130→```
   131→
   132→### Building Windows Installer (Unsigned)
   133→
   134→```cmd
   135→cd installer\windows
   136→build-exe.bat
   137→```
   138→
   139→Output: `dist\SPLICE-Installer-{version}.exe`
   140→
   141→### Building Windows Installer (Signed)
   142→
   143→```cmd
   144→set CODE_SIGN_CERT=path\to\certificate.pfx
   145→set CODE_SIGN_PASSWORD=your-certificate-password
   146→
   147→build-exe.bat
   148→```
   149→
   150→## Code Signing
   151→
   152→### macOS Code Signing Requirements
   153→
   154→For complete step-by-step instructions, see: [`installer/macos/create-app-specific-password.md`](macos/create-app-specific-password.md)
   155→
   156→#### Quick Start
   157→
   158→1. **Apple Developer Program membership** ($99/year)
   159→
   160→2. **Check for existing Developer ID Installer certificate**:
   161→   ```bash
   162→   security find-identity -v -p basic | grep "Developer ID Installer"
   163→   ```
   164→
   165→3. **If no certificate exists, create one**:
   166→   
   167→   a. Open **Keychain Access** → Certificate Assistant → Request a Certificate From a Certificate Authority
   168→   
   169→   b. Save the CSR file to disk
   170→   
   171→   c. Go to [developer.apple.com/account/resources/certificates](https://developer.apple.com/account/resources/certificates)
   172→   
   173→   d. Click "+" → Select **"Developer ID Installer"** (NOT Developer ID Application!)
   174→   
   175→   e. Upload the CSR file → Download the certificate → Double-click to install
   176→
   177→4. **Create App-Specific Password** (for notarization):
   178→   - Go to [appleid.apple.com](https://appleid.apple.com)
   179→   - Sign In & Security → App-Specific Passwords
   180→   - Generate a new password for "SPLICE Notarization"
   181→   - Store in keychain: `xcrun notarytool store-credentials "AC_PASSWORD" --apple-id "your@email.com" --team-id "TEAM_ID" --password "xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx"`
   182→
   183→5. **Find your Team ID**:
   184→   ```bash
   185→   security find-identity -v -p basic | grep "Developer ID Installer"
   186→   # Team ID is the letters/numbers in parentheses at the end
   187→   ```
   188→
   189→### Signing and Notarizing the PKG
   190→
   191→Use the dedicated signing script:
   192→
   193→```bash
   194→# Sign only (no notarization)
   195→./macos/sign-and-notarize.sh --no-notarize dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg
   196→
   197→# Sign and notarize (using stored keychain credentials)
   198→./macos/sign-and-notarize.sh \
   199→    --apple-id "your@email.com" \
   200→    --team-id "TEAM_ID" \
   201→    --password "@keychain:AC_PASSWORD" \
   202→    dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg
   203→
   204→# Sign and notarize (using environment variables)
   205→export APPLE_ID="your@email.com"
   206→export TEAM_ID="TEAM_ID"
   207→export APP_PASSWORD="xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx"
   208→./macos/sign-and-notarize.sh dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg
   209→```
   210→
   211→The script will:
   212→1. Auto-detect your Developer ID Installer certificate
   213→2. Sign the PKG with `productsign`
   214→3. Submit to Apple's notary service
   215→4. Wait for notarization to complete
   216→5. Staple the notarization ticket to the PKG
   217→6. Verify the final package
   218→
   219→Output: `dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg`
   220→
   221→### Verifying the Signed Package
   222→
   223→```bash
   224→# Check signature
   225→pkgutil --check-signature dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg
   226→
   227→# Check Gatekeeper assessment
   228→spctl --assess -vv --type install dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg
   229→
   230→# Verify notarization staple
   231→xcrun stapler validate dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg
   232→```
   233→
   234→### macOS Notarization Process
   235→
   236→Notarization is required for Gatekeeper approval on macOS 10.15+:
   237→
   238→1. Package is uploaded to Apple's notary service
   239→2. Apple scans for malware and validates signing
   240→3. Notarization ticket is stapled to the package
   241→4. Users can install without security warnings
   242→
   243→The sign-and-notarize.sh script handles this automatically.
   244→
   245→### Windows Code Signing Requirements
   246→
   247→1. **Code Signing Certificate** from a trusted CA:
   248→   - [DigiCert](https://www.digicert.com/signing/code-signing-certificates)
   249→   - [Sectigo](https://sectigo.com/ssl-certificates-tls/code-signing)
   250→   - [GlobalSign](https://www.globalsign.com/en/code-signing-certificate)
   251→   
   252→   Prices range from ~$200-500/year.
   253→
   254→2. **Extended Validation (EV) Certificate** (recommended):
   255→   - Provides immediate SmartScreen reputation
   256→   - Requires hardware token (USB key)
   257→   - Higher cost but better user experience
   258→
   259→3. **Standard Certificate**:
   260→   - Lower cost
   261→   - Requires building reputation with SmartScreen
   262→   - Initial users may see warnings
   263→
   264→### Using signtool (Windows SDK)
   265→
   266→```cmd
   267→signtool sign /f certificate.pfx /p password /t http://timestamp.digicert.com /d "SPLICE Installer" SPLICE-Installer.exe
   268→```
   269→
   270→### Using osslsigncode (Cross-Platform)
   271→
   272→```bash
   273→osslsigncode sign -pkcs12 certificate.pfx -pass password -n "SPLICE Installer" -t http://timestamp.digicert.com -in unsigned.exe -out signed.exe
   274→```
   275→
   276→## Version Management
   277→
   278→Version is centralized in `shared/version.json`:
   279→
   280→```json
   281→{
   282→  "version": "6.0.3",
   283→  "bundleId": "com.splice.panel"
   284→}
   285→```
   286→
   287→To update the version:
   288→
   289→1. Edit `shared/version.json`
   290→2. Update `splice-cep/CSXS/manifest.xml`
   291→3. Update `splice-plugin/manifest.json`
   292→4. Rebuild installers
   293→
   294→Or use the sync script:
   295→
   296→```bash
   297→npm run sync-version
   298→```
   299→
   300→## CI/CD with GitHub Actions
   301→
   302→### Setting Up Secrets
   303→
   304→Add these secrets to your GitHub repository:
   305→
   306→**macOS Signing:**
   307→- `MACOS_CERTIFICATE`: Base64-encoded .p12 certificate
   308→- `MACOS_CERTIFICATE_PWD`: Certificate password
   309→- `MACOS_SIGNING_IDENTITY`: Full certificate name
   310→- `KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD`: Random password for temp keychain
   311→- `APPLE_ID`: Apple ID email
   312→- `APPLE_TEAM_ID`: Apple Developer Team ID
   313→- `APPLE_APP_PASSWORD`: App-specific password
   314→
   315→**Windows Signing:**
   316→- `WINDOWS_CERTIFICATE`: Base64-encoded .pfx certificate
   317→- `WINDOWS_CERTIFICATE_PWD`: Certificate password
   318→
   319→### Encoding Certificates for Secrets
   320→
   321→```bash
   322→# macOS
   323→base64 -i certificate.p12 -o certificate-base64.txt
   324→
   325→# Windows (PowerShell)
   326→[Convert]::ToBase64String([IO.File]::ReadAllBytes("certificate.pfx")) | Out-File certificate-base64.txt
   327→```
   328→
   329→### Triggering Builds
   330→
   331→- **Automatic**: Push a tag like `v6.0.3`
   332→- **Manual**: Use GitHub Actions "Run workflow" button
   333→- **PR builds**: Automatically builds on pull requests (unsigned)
   334→
   335→### Release Process
   336→
   337→1. Update version in `shared/version.json`
   338→2. Commit changes
   339→3. Create and push tag:
   340→   ```bash
   341→   git tag v6.0.3
   342→   git push origin v6.0.3
   343→   ```
   344→4. GitHub Actions builds signed installers
   345→5. Draft release is created with artifacts
   346→6. Review and publish the release
   347→
   348→## Testing
   349→
   350→### Local Testing
   351→
   352→**macOS:**
   353→```bash
   354→# Test installation
   355→sudo installer -pkg dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg -target /
   356→
   357→# Verify installation
   358→ls -la "/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/com.splice.panel"
   359→```
   360→
   361→**Windows:**
   362→```cmd
   363→# Run installer
   364→dist\SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.exe
   365→
   366→# Verify installation
   367→dir "C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Adobe\CEP\extensions\com.splice.panel"
   368→```
   369→
   370→### Testing Checklist
   371→
   372→- [ ] Installer runs without errors
   373→- [ ] CEP extension appears in Premiere Pro Extensions menu
   374→- [ ] UXP plugin appears in Premiere Pro 25+ (if applicable)
   375→- [ ] Uninstaller removes all files
   376→- [ ] No leftover files or registry entries
   377→
   378→## Troubleshooting
   379→
   380→### macOS Issues
   381→
   382→**"unidentified developer" warning:**
   383→- The package is not signed or notarized
   384→- Solution: Sign and notarize, or right-click → Open
   385→
   386→**"damaged and can't be opened" error:**
   387→- Quarantine attribute issue
   388→- Solution: `xattr -cr SPLICE-Installer.pkg`
   389→
   390→**Notarization fails:**
   391→- Check Apple ID and app-specific password
   392→- Ensure certificate is valid and not expired
   393→- Check for hardened runtime issues
   394→
   395→### Windows Issues
   396→
   397→**SmartScreen warning:**
   398→- The installer is not signed or lacks reputation
   399→- Solution: Sign with EV certificate, or users click "More info" → "Run anyway"
   400→
   401→**NSIS not found:**
   402→- Install NSIS and add to PATH
   403→- Or set `NSIS_PATH` environment variable
   404→
   405→**Installation fails with UAC prompt:**
   406→- Run as administrator
   407→- Check antivirus isn't blocking
   408→
   409→### General Issues
   410→
   411→**CEP extension not showing:**
   412→- Enable debug mode: 
   413→  - macOS: `defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.11 PlayerDebugMode 1`
   414→  - Windows: Add registry key `PlayerDebugMode = 1` under `HKCU\Software\Adobe\CSXS.11`
   415→- Restart Premiere Pro
   416→
   417→**UXP plugin not showing:**
   418→- Verify Premiere Pro version is 25.0+
   419→- Check Creative Cloud Desktop for plugin status
   420→- Try manual CCX installation
   421→
   422→## Support
   423→
   424→For build issues, contact the development team or check the GitHub Issues page.
   425→

</system-reminder>

file.content:
# SPLICE Installer Build Guide

This document provides complete instructions for building the SPLICE installers for macOS and Windows.

## Overview

The SPLICE installer system creates native platform installers that provide a FireCut-style one-click installation experience:

- **macOS**: Native `.pkg` installer built with `pkgbuild` and `productbuild`
- **Windows**: `.exe` installer built with NSIS (Nullsoft Scriptable Install System)
- **UXP Plugin**: `.ccx` package for Premiere Pro 25.0+

## Directory Structure

```
installer/
├── .github/
│   └── workflows/
│       └── build-installers.yml    # GitHub Actions CI/CD
├── macos/
│   ├── build-pkg.sh                # macOS build script
│   ├── distribution.xml            # productbuild configuration
│   ├── uninstall.sh               # Uninstaller script
│   ├── resources/                  # Installer UI HTML files
│   │   ├── welcome.html
│   │   ├── readme.html
│   │   ├── license.html
│   │   └── conclusion.html
│   └── scripts/
│       ├── preinstall              # Pre-installation script
│       └── postinstall             # Post-installation script
├── windows/
│   ├── splice-installer.nsi        # NSIS installer script
│   └── build-exe.bat               # Windows build script
├── scripts/
│   ├── build-ccx.sh               # CCX packager (Unix)
│   └── build-ccx.bat              # CCX packager (Windows)
├── shared/
│   ├── version.json               # Version configuration
│   └── assets/
│       ├── license.txt            # EULA
│       ├── installer-icon.ico     # Windows installer icon
│       └── ...                    # Other assets
├── package.json                   # Node.js dependencies
└── BUILD.md                       # This file
```

## Prerequisites

### macOS Build Requirements

- macOS 10.14 or later
- Xcode Command Line Tools (`xcode-select --install`)
- For signing: Apple Developer ID Installer certificate
- For notarization: Apple Developer account with App-Specific Password

### Windows Build Requirements

- Windows 10 or later
- [NSIS 3.x](https://nsis.sourceforge.io/Download) (add to PATH)
- For signing: Code signing certificate (.pfx file)
- Optional: [Windows SDK](https://developer.microsoft.com/windows/downloads/windows-sdk/) for `signtool`

### Cross-Platform Requirements

- Node.js 18+ and npm
- Git
- zip utility (included on macOS, use PowerShell on Windows)

## Building the Installers

### Quick Start (Local Build)

```bash
# Install dependencies
cd installer
npm install

# Build macOS installer (on macOS)
./macos/build-pkg.sh

# Build Windows installer (on Windows)
windows\build-exe.bat
```

### Building the CCX Package

The CCX package is required for UXP plugin support (Premiere Pro 25+):

```bash
# On macOS/Linux
./scripts/build-ccx.sh

# On Windows
scripts\build-ccx.bat
```

The CCX file will be created at `shared/splice-uxp.ccx`.

### Building macOS Installer (Unsigned)

```bash
cd installer
./macos/build-pkg.sh
```

Output: `dist/SPLICE-Installer-{version}.pkg`

### Building macOS Installer (Signed + Notarized)

```bash
./macos/build-pkg.sh \
  --sign "Developer ID Installer: Your Company (TEAM_ID)" \
  --notarize \
  --apple-id "your@email.com" \
  --team-id "TEAM_ID" \
  --password "app-specific-password"
```

Or using environment variables:

```bash
export SIGNING_IDENTITY="Developer ID Installer: Your Company (TEAM_ID)"
export NOTARIZE=true
export APPLE_ID="your@email.com"
export TEAM_ID="TEAM_ID"
export APP_PASSWORD="app-specific-password"

./macos/build-pkg.sh
```

### Building Windows Installer (Unsigned)

```cmd
cd installer\windows
build-exe.bat
```

Output: `dist\SPLICE-Installer-{version}.exe`

### Building Windows Installer (Signed)

```cmd
set CODE_SIGN_CERT=path\to\certificate.pfx
set CODE_SIGN_PASSWORD=your-certificate-password

build-exe.bat
```

## Code Signing

### macOS Code Signing Requirements

For complete step-by-step instructions, see: [`installer/macos/create-app-specific-password.md`](macos/create-app-specific-password.md)

#### Quick Start

1. **Apple Developer Program membership** ($99/year)

2. **Check for existing Developer ID Installer certificate**:
   ```bash
   security find-identity -v -p basic | grep "Developer ID Installer"
   ```

3. **If no certificate exists, create one**:
   
   a. Open **Keychain Access** → Certificate Assistant → Request a Certificate From a Certificate Authority
   
   b. Save the CSR file to disk
   
   c. Go to [developer.apple.com/account/resources/certificates](https://developer.apple.com/account/resources/certificates)
   
   d. Click "+" → Select **"Developer ID Installer"** (NOT Developer ID Application!)
   
   e. Upload the CSR file → Download the certificate → Double-click to install

4. **Create App-Specific Password** (for notarization):
   - Go to [appleid.apple.com](https://appleid.apple.com)
   - Sign In & Security → App-Specific Passwords
   - Generate a new password for "SPLICE Notarization"
   - Store in keychain: `xcrun notarytool store-credentials "AC_PASSWORD" --apple-id "your@email.com" --team-id "TEAM_ID" --password "xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx"`

5. **Find your Team ID**:
   ```bash
   security find-identity -v -p basic | grep "Developer ID Installer"
   # Team ID is the letters/numbers in parentheses at the end
   ```

### Signing and Notarizing the PKG

Use the dedicated signing script:

```bash
# Sign only (no notarization)
./macos/sign-and-notarize.sh --no-notarize dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg

# Sign and notarize (using stored keychain credentials)
./macos/sign-and-notarize.sh \
    --apple-id "your@email.com" \
    --team-id "TEAM_ID" \
    --password "@keychain:AC_PASSWORD" \
    dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg

# Sign and notarize (using environment variables)
export APPLE_ID="your@email.com"
export TEAM_ID="TEAM_ID"
export APP_PASSWORD="xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx"
./macos/sign-and-notarize.sh dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg
```

The script will:
1. Auto-detect your Developer ID Installer certificate
2. Sign the PKG with `productsign`
3. Submit to Apple's notary service
4. Wait for notarization to complete
5. Staple the notarization ticket to the PKG
6. Verify the final package

Output: `dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg`

### Verifying the Signed Package

```bash
# Check signature
pkgutil --check-signature dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg

# Check Gatekeeper assessment
spctl --assess -vv --type install dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg

# Verify notarization staple
xcrun stapler validate dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg
```

### macOS Notarization Process

Notarization is required for Gatekeeper approval on macOS 10.15+:

1. Package is uploaded to Apple's notary service
2. Apple scans for malware and validates signing
3. Notarization ticket is stapled to the package
4. Users can install without security warnings

The sign-and-notarize.sh script handles this automatically.

### Windows Code Signing Requirements

1. **Code Signing Certificate** from a trusted CA:
   - [DigiCert](https://www.digicert.com/signing/code-signing-certificates)
   - [Sectigo](https://sectigo.com/ssl-certificates-tls/code-signing)
   - [GlobalSign](https://www.globalsign.com/en/code-signing-certificate)
   
   Prices range from ~$200-500/year.

2. **Extended Validation (EV) Certificate** (recommended):
   - Provides immediate SmartScreen reputation
   - Requires hardware token (USB key)
   - Higher cost but better user experience

3. **Standard Certificate**:
   - Lower cost
   - Requires building reputation with SmartScreen
   - Initial users may see warnings

### Using signtool (Windows SDK)

```cmd
signtool sign /f certificate.pfx /p password /t http://timestamp.digicert.com /d "SPLICE Installer" SPLICE-Installer.exe
```

### Using osslsigncode (Cross-Platform)

```bash
osslsigncode sign -pkcs12 certificate.pfx -pass password -n "SPLICE Installer" -t http://timestamp.digicert.com -in unsigned.exe -out signed.exe
```

## Version Management

Version is centralized in `shared/version.json`:

```json
{
  "version": "6.0.3",
  "bundleId": "com.splice.panel"
}
```

To update the version:

1. Edit `shared/version.json`
2. Update `splice-cep/CSXS/manifest.xml`
3. Update `splice-plugin/manifest.json`
4. Rebuild installers

Or use the sync script:

```bash
npm run sync-version
```

## CI/CD with GitHub Actions

### Setting Up Secrets

Add these secrets to your GitHub repository:

**macOS Signing:**
- `MACOS_CERTIFICATE`: Base64-encoded .p12 certificate
- `MACOS_CERTIFICATE_PWD`: Certificate password
- `MACOS_SIGNING_IDENTITY`: Full certificate name
- `KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD`: Random password for temp keychain
- `APPLE_ID`: Apple ID email
- `APPLE_TEAM_ID`: Apple Developer Team ID
- `APPLE_APP_PASSWORD`: App-specific password

**Windows Signing:**
- `WINDOWS_CERTIFICATE`: Base64-encoded .pfx certificate
- `WINDOWS_CERTIFICATE_PWD`: Certificate password

### Encoding Certificates for Secrets

```bash
# macOS
base64 -i certificate.p12 -o certificate-base64.txt

# Windows (PowerShell)
[Convert]::ToBase64String([IO.File]::ReadAllBytes("certificate.pfx")) | Out-File certificate-base64.txt
```

### Triggering Builds

- **Automatic**: Push a tag like `v6.0.3`
- **Manual**: Use GitHub Actions "Run workflow" button
- **PR builds**: Automatically builds on pull requests (unsigned)

### Release Process

1. Update version in `shared/version.json`
2. Commit changes
3. Create and push tag:
   ```bash
   git tag v6.0.3
   git push origin v6.0.3
   ```
4. GitHub Actions builds signed installers
5. Draft release is created with artifacts
6. Review and publish the release

## Testing

### Local Testing

**macOS:**
```bash
# Test installation
sudo installer -pkg dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg -target /

# Verify installation
ls -la "/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/com.splice.panel"
```

**Windows:**
```cmd
# Run installer
dist\SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.exe

# Verify installation
dir "C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Adobe\CEP\extensions\com.splice.panel"
```

### Testing Checklist

- [ ] Installer runs without errors
- [ ] CEP extension appears in Premiere Pro Extensions menu
- [ ] UXP plugin appears in Premiere Pro 25+ (if applicable)
- [ ] Uninstaller removes all files
- [ ] No leftover files or registry entries

## Troubleshooting

### macOS Issues

**"unidentified developer" warning:**
- The package is not signed or notarized
- Solution: Sign and notarize, or right-click → Open

**"damaged and can't be opened" error:**
- Quarantine attribute issue
- Solution: `xattr -cr SPLICE-Installer.pkg`

**Notarization fails:**
- Check Apple ID and app-specific password
- Ensure certificate is valid and not expired
- Check for hardened runtime issues

### Windows Issues

**SmartScreen warning:**
- The installer is not signed or lacks reputation
- Solution: Sign with EV certificate, or users click "More info" → "Run anyway"

**NSIS not found:**
- Install NSIS and add to PATH
- Or set `NSIS_PATH` environment variable

**Installation fails with UAC prompt:**
- Run as administrator
- Check antivirus isn't blocking

### General Issues

**CEP extension not showing:**
- Enable debug mode: 
  - macOS: `defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.11 PlayerDebugMode 1`
  - Windows: Add registry key `PlayerDebugMode = 1` under `HKCU\Software\Adobe\CSXS.11`
- Restart Premiere Pro

**UXP plugin not showing:**
- Verify Premiere Pro version is 25.0+
- Check Creative Cloud Desktop for plugin status
- Try manual CCX installation

## Support

For build issues, contact the development team or check the GitHub Issues page.

file.content:
# SPLICE Installation Guide

Welcome to SPLICE! This guide will help you install the SPLICE plugin for Adobe Premiere Pro.

## System Requirements

- **Adobe Premiere Pro**: Version 14.0 (2020) or later
- **macOS**: 10.14 Mojave or later
- **Windows**: Windows 10 (1903) or later
- **Disk Space**: 50 MB free space

## Quick Installation

### macOS

1. **Download** the installer: `SPLICE-Installer-x.x.x.pkg`
2. **Double-click** the downloaded file
3. **Follow** the on-screen instructions
4. **Restart** Premiere Pro if it's running
5. **Access SPLICE** from Window → Extensions → SPLICE

### Windows

1. **Download** the installer: `SPLICE-Installer-x.x.x.exe`
2. **Double-click** the downloaded file
3. If prompted by Windows SmartScreen, click "More info" → "Run anyway"
4. **Follow** the installation wizard
5. **Restart** Premiere Pro if it's running
6. **Access SPLICE** from Window → Extensions → SPLICE

## Detailed Installation Steps

### macOS Installation

#### Step 1: Download
Download the latest `SPLICE-Installer-x.x.x.pkg` file from the official SPLICE website or your provided download link.

#### Step 2: Run Installer
Double-click the `.pkg` file to launch the installer. If you see a message saying the app is from an unidentified developer:
1. Right-click (or Control-click) the installer
2. Select "Open" from the menu
3. Click "Open" in the dialog

#### Step 3: Follow Wizard
1. **Welcome**: Click Continue
2. **License Agreement**: Read and agree to the terms
3. **Installation Type**: Choose Standard (recommended)
4. **Install**: Enter your password when prompted
5. **Complete**: Click Close

#### Step 4: Verify Installation
1. Open Adobe Premiere Pro
2. Go to **Window → Extensions**
3. You should see **SPLICE** in the menu
4. Click it to open the SPLICE panel

### Windows Installation

#### Step 1: Download
Download the latest `SPLICE-Installer-x.x.x.exe` file from the official SPLICE website.

#### Step 2: Run Installer
Double-click the `.exe` file. If Windows SmartScreen appears:
1. Click "More info"
2. Click "Run anyway"

This happens because the installer is new and hasn't built up Windows reputation yet.

#### Step 3: Follow Wizard
1. **Welcome**: Click Next
2. **License Agreement**: Read and accept the terms
3. **Installation Location**: Keep default or choose custom
4. **Components**: Select which components to install
5. **Install**: Click Install
6. **Complete**: Click Finish

#### Step 4: Verify Installation
1. Open Adobe Premiere Pro
2. Go to **Window → Extensions**
3. You should see **SPLICE** in the menu
4. Click it to open the SPLICE panel

## What Gets Installed

### CEP Extension (All Premiere Pro Versions)
- **Location (macOS)**: `/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/com.splice.panel/`
- **Location (Windows)**: `C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Adobe\CEP\extensions\com.splice.panel\`
- **Purpose**: Panel UI and Premiere Pro integration

### UXP Plugin (Premiere Pro 25.0+)
- **Location**: Managed by Adobe Creative Cloud
- **Purpose**: Enhanced features for Premiere Pro 2025 and later

## Uninstallation

### macOS

**Option 1: Using Uninstaller Script**
1. Open Terminal
2. Run: `"/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/com.splice.panel/uninstall.sh"`
3. Enter your password when prompted

**Option 2: Manual Removal**
1. Open Finder
2. Go to: `/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/`
3. Delete the `com.splice.panel` folder
4. Empty Trash

### Windows

**Option 1: Via Settings**
1. Open Settings → Apps → Apps & features
2. Find "SPLICE"
3. Click Uninstall

**Option 2: Via Control Panel**
1. Open Control Panel → Programs → Programs and Features
2. Find "SPLICE"
3. Click Uninstall

## Troubleshooting

### SPLICE doesn't appear in Extensions menu

**Enable Debug Mode:**

*macOS:*
```bash
defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.11 PlayerDebugMode 1
```

*Windows:*
1. Open Registry Editor (regedit)
2. Navigate to `HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Adobe\CSXS.11`
3. Create a new String Value called `PlayerDebugMode`
4. Set its value to `1`

Then restart Premiere Pro.

### "Extension could not be loaded" error

1. Close Premiere Pro completely
2. Navigate to the extensions folder
3. Verify `com.splice.panel` folder exists and contains files
4. Restart Premiere Pro

### macOS: "damaged and can't be opened" error

Run this command in Terminal:
```bash
xattr -cr /path/to/SPLICE-Installer.pkg
```
Then try running the installer again.

### Windows: SmartScreen blocks the installer

1. Click "More info"
2. Click "Run anyway"

This is normal for new software that hasn't built up Windows reputation.

### Extension loads but shows blank panel

1. Check your internet connection
2. Verify firewall isn't blocking the extension
3. Try restarting Premiere Pro
4. Reinstall if issue persists

### UXP Plugin not appearing (Premiere Pro 25+)

1. Open Creative Cloud Desktop
2. Go to Stock & Marketplace → Plugins → Installed
3. Check if SPLICE appears
4. If not, the CEP extension will still work

## Getting Help

If you continue to experience issues:

1. **Documentation**: Visit our online documentation
2. **Email Support**: contact@splice.com
3. **Discord**: Join our community Discord server

When contacting support, please include:
- Your operating system and version
- Adobe Premiere Pro version
- Screenshot of any error messages
- Steps you've already tried

## Updating SPLICE

To update SPLICE:
1. Download the latest installer
2. Run it (it will update the existing installation)
3. Restart Premiere Pro

Your settings and preferences will be preserved during updates.

---

Thank you for choosing SPLICE! We hope it enhances your video editing workflow.

content.text: Now let me examine the build scripts and plugin structure:

content.content:
1→#!/bin/bash
     2→#
     3→# SPLICE Plugin - macOS PKG Installer Build Script
     4→# Builds a signed .pkg installer using pkgbuild and productbuild
     5→#
     6→
     7→set -e
     8→
     9→# Script directory
    10→SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
    11→PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/../.." && pwd)"
    12→INSTALLER_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR"
    13→
    14→# Source directories
    15→CEP_SOURCE="$PROJECT_ROOT/splice-cep"
    16→UXP_SOURCE="$PROJECT_ROOT/splice-plugin"
    17→SHARED_ASSETS="$SCRIPT_DIR/../shared/assets"
    18→
    19→# Build directories

#!/bin/bash
#
# SPLICE Plugin - macOS PKG Installer Build Script
# Builds a signed .pkg installer using pkgbuild and productbuild
#

set -e

# Script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/../.." && pwd)"
INSTALLER_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR"

# Source directories
CEP_SOURCE="$PROJECT_ROOT/splice-cep"
UXP_SOURCE="$PROJECT_ROOT/splice-plugin"
SHARED_ASSETS="$SCRIPT_DIR/../shared/assets"

# Build directories
BUILD_DIR="$INSTALLER_DIR/build"
STAGING_DIR="$BUILD_DIR/staging"
OUTPUT_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/dist"

# Version info
VERSION_FILE="$SCRIPT_DIR/../shared/version.json"
if [ -f "$VERSION_FILE" ]; then
    VERSION=$(grep -o '"version"[[:space:]]*:[[:space:]]*"[^"]*"' "$VERSION_FILE" | cut -d'"' -f4)
else
    VERSION="6.0.3"
fi

# Package identifiers
BUNDLE_ID="com.splice.panel"
CEP_PKG_ID="${BUNDLE_ID}.cep"
UXP_PKG_ID="${BUNDLE_ID}.uxp"

# Signing identity (set via environment or parameter)
SIGNING_IDENTITY="${SIGNING_IDENTITY:-}"
NOTARIZE="${NOTARIZE:-false}"
APPLE_ID="${APPLE_ID:-}"
TEAM_ID="${TEAM_ID:-}"
APP_PASSWORD="${APP_PASSWORD:-}"

# Output filenames
PKG_NAME="SPLICE-Installer-${VERSION}.pkg"
UNSIGNED_PKG_NAME="SPLICE-Installer-${VERSION}-unsigned.pkg"

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

log_info() {
    echo -e "${GREEN}[INFO]${NC} $1"
}

log_warn() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARN]${NC} $1"
}

log_error() {
    echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"
}

# Show usage
usage() {
    echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
    echo ""
    echo "Options:"
    echo "  --sign IDENTITY     Sign package with Developer ID Installer certificate"
    echo "  --notarize          Notarize the signed package (requires --sign)"
    echo "  --apple-id EMAIL    Apple ID for notarization"
    echo "  --team-id ID        Team ID for notarization"
    echo "  --password PWD      App-specific password for notarization"
    echo "  --help              Show this help message"
    echo ""
    echo "Environment variables:"
    echo "  SIGNING_IDENTITY    Developer ID Installer certificate name"
    echo "  NOTARIZE            Set to 'true' to notarize"
    echo "  APPLE_ID            Apple ID email"
    echo "  TEAM_ID             Apple Developer Team ID"
    echo "  APP_PASSWORD        App-specific password for notarization"
    exit 1
}

# Parse arguments
while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
    case $1 in
        --sign)
            SIGNING_IDENTITY="$2"
            shift 2
            ;;
        --notarize)
            NOTARIZE="true"
            shift
            ;;
        --apple-id)
            APPLE_ID="$2"
            shift 2
            ;;
        --team-id)
            TEAM_ID="$2"
            shift 2
            ;;
        --password)
            APP_PASSWORD="$2"
            shift 2
            ;;
        --help)
            usage
            ;;
        *)
            log_error "Unknown option: $1"
            usage
            ;;
    esac
done

# Cleanup previous builds
cleanup() {
    log_info "Cleaning up previous builds..."
    rm -rf "$BUILD_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$BUILD_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$STAGING_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$OUTPUT_DIR"
}

# Stage CEP extension files
stage_cep() {
    log_info "Staging CEP extension..."
    
    if [ ! -d "$CEP_SOURCE" ]; then
        log_error "CEP source directory not found: $CEP_SOURCE"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Create staging structure
    local cep_staging="$STAGING_DIR/cep/tmp/splice-installer/cep"
    mkdir -p "$cep_staging"
    
    # Copy CEP extension files
    cp -R "$CEP_SOURCE/CSXS" "$cep_staging/"
    cp -R "$CEP_SOURCE/jsx" "$cep_staging/"
    cp -R "$CEP_SOURCE/panel" "$cep_staging/"
    
    # Copy additional files if they exist
    [ -f "$CEP_SOURCE/.debug" ] && cp "$CEP_SOURCE/.debug" "$cep_staging/"
    [ -f "$CEP_SOURCE/mimetype" ] && cp "$CEP_SOURCE/mimetype" "$cep_staging/"
    
    log_info "CEP extension staged"
}

# Stage UXP plugin files and create CCX
stage_uxp() {
    log_info "Staging UXP plugin..."
    
    if [ ! -d "$UXP_SOURCE" ]; then
        log_warn "UXP source directory not found: $UXP_SOURCE"
        log_warn "Skipping UXP plugin packaging"
        return 0
    fi
    
    # Create staging structure
    local uxp_staging="$STAGING_DIR/uxp/tmp/splice-installer"
    mkdir -p "$uxp_staging"
    
    # Create CCX package (essentially a zip with .ccx extension)
    local ccx_temp="$BUILD_DIR/ccx-temp"
    mkdir -p "$ccx_temp"
    
    # Copy UXP plugin files
    cp -R "$UXP_SOURCE"/* "$ccx_temp/"
    
    # Create the CCX file
    pushd "$ccx_temp" > /dev/null
    zip -r "$uxp_staging/splice-uxp.ccx" . -x "*.DS_Store" -x "__MACOSX/*"
    popd > /dev/null
    
    rm -rf "$ccx_temp"
    
    log_info "UXP plugin staged as CCX"
}

# Build component packages
build_component_packages() {
    log_info "Building component packages..."
    
    # Build CEP package
    pkgbuild \
        --root "$STAGING_DIR/cep" \
        --identifier "$CEP_PKG_ID" \
        --version "$VERSION" \
        --scripts "$INSTALLER_DIR/scripts" \
        "$BUILD_DIR/splice-cep.pkg"
    
    log_info "CEP component package created"
    
    # Build UXP package if CCX was created
    if [ -f "$STAGING_DIR/uxp/tmp/splice-installer/splice-uxp.ccx" ]; then
        pkgbuild \
            --root "$STAGING_DIR/uxp" \
            --identifier "$UXP_PKG_ID" \
            --version "$VERSION" \
            "$BUILD_DIR/splice-uxp.pkg"
        
        log_info "UXP component package created"
    fi
}

# Build product archive
build_product() {
    log_info "Building product archive..."
    
    # Prepare resources directory
    local resources_dir="$BUILD_DIR/resources"
    mkdir -p "$resources_dir"
    
    # Copy installer UI resources
    cp "$INSTALLER_DIR/resources/"*.html "$resources_dir/" 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Copy shared assets
    if [ -d "$SHARED_ASSETS" ]; then
        cp "$SHARED_ASSETS/"* "$resources_dir/" 2>/dev/null || true
    fi
    
    # Update distribution.xml with actual package references
    local dist_xml="$BUILD_DIR/distribution.xml"
    cp "$INSTALLER_DIR/distribution.xml" "$dist_xml"
    
    # Replace version placeholder
    sed -i '' "s/version=\"6.0.3\"/version=\"$VERSION\"/g" "$dist_xml"
    
    # Build the product
    local output_pkg="$OUTPUT_DIR/$UNSIGNED_PKG_NAME"
    
    productbuild \
        --distribution "$dist_xml" \
        --resources "$resources_dir" \
        --package-path "$BUILD_DIR" \
        "$output_pkg"
    
    log_info "Unsigned package created: $output_pkg"
}

# Sign the package
sign_package() {
    if [ -z "$SIGNING_IDENTITY" ]; then
        log_warn "No signing identity provided, skipping signing"
        log_warn "Package will show 'unidentified developer' warning on macOS"
        
        # Rename unsigned package if not signing
        mv "$OUTPUT_DIR/$UNSIGNED_PKG_NAME" "$OUTPUT_DIR/$PKG_NAME"
        return 0
    fi
    
    log_info "Signing package with identity: $SIGNING_IDENTITY"
    
    local unsigned_pkg="$OUTPUT_DIR/$UNSIGNED_PKG_NAME"
    local signed_pkg="$OUTPUT_DIR/$PKG_NAME"
    
    productsign \
        --sign "$SIGNING_IDENTITY" \
        "$unsigned_pkg" \
        "$signed_pkg"
    
    # Verify signature
    pkgutil --check-signature "$signed_pkg"
    
    # Remove unsigned package
    rm "$unsigned_pkg"
    
    log_info "Package signed successfully: $signed_pkg"
}

# Notarize the package
notarize_package() {
    if [ "$NOTARIZE" != "true" ]; then
        log_info "Skipping notarization"
        return 0
    fi
    
    if [ -z "$APPLE_ID" ] || [ -z "$TEAM_ID" ] || [ -z "$APP_PASSWORD" ]; then
        log_error "Notarization requires APPLE_ID, TEAM_ID, and APP_PASSWORD"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    log_info "Notarizing package..."
    
    local pkg_path="$OUTPUT_DIR/$PKG_NAME"
    
    # Submit for notarization
    xcrun notarytool submit "$pkg_path" \
        --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
        --team-id "$TEAM_ID" \
        --password "$APP_PASSWORD" \
        --wait
    
    # Staple the notarization ticket
    log_info "Stapling notarization ticket..."
    xcrun stapler staple "$pkg_path"
    
    # Verify stapling
    xcrun stapler validate "$pkg_path"
    
    log_info "Package notarized and stapled successfully"
}

# Main build process
main() {
    echo "========================================"
    echo "SPLICE macOS Installer Build"
    echo "Version: $VERSION"
    echo "========================================"
    echo ""
    
    cleanup
    stage_cep
    stage_uxp
    build_component_packages
    build_product
    sign_package
    notarize_package
    
    echo ""
    echo "========================================"
    log_info "Build complete!"
    echo "Output: $OUTPUT_DIR/$PKG_NAME"
    echo "========================================"
}

main

     2→#!/bin/bash
     3→# =============================================================================
     4→# SPLICE PKG Signing and Notarization Script
     5→# =============================================================================
     6→# This script signs a macOS PKG installer with Developer ID Installer certificate
     7→# and submits it to Apple's notary service for notarization.
     8→#
     9→# Prerequisites:
    10→#   - Developer ID Installer certificate installed in Keychain
    11→#   - Apple ID with App-Specific Password for notarization
    12→#   - xcrun notarytool (macOS 12+) or altool (legacy)
    13→#
    14→# Usage:
    15→#   ./sign-and-notarize.sh [options] <unsigned-pkg>
    16→#
    17→# Options:
    18→#   --identity    Certificate identity (default: auto-detect)
    19→#   --apple-id    Apple ID email for notarization
    20→#   --team-id     Apple Developer Team ID
    21→#   --password    App-specific password (or @keychain:name)
    22→#   --no-notarize Skip notarization (signing only)
    23→#   --output      Output path for signed PKG
    24→#   --help        Show this help message
    25→#
    26→# Environment Variables (alternative to options):
    27→#   SIGNING_IDENTITY  - Certificate identity
    28→#   APPLE_ID          - Apple ID email
    29→#   TEAM_ID           - Apple Developer Team ID  
    30→#   APP_PASSWORD      - App-specific password
    31→#
    32→# Example:
    33→#   ./sign-and-notarize.sh \
    34→#     --identity "Developer ID Installer: Your Company (TEAM_ID)" \
    35→#     --apple-id "your@email.com" \
    36→#     --team-id "TEAM_ID" \
    37→#     --password "@keychain:AC_PASSWORD" \
    38→#     dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg
    39→# =============================================================================
    40→
    41→set -e  # Exit on error
    42→
    43→# Colors for output
    44→RED='\033[0;31m'
    45→GREEN='\033[0;32m'
    46→YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
    47→BLUE='\033[0;34m'
    48→NC='\033[0m' # No Color
    49→
    50→# Script directory
    51→SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
    52→PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/../.." && pwd)"
    53→
    54→# Default values from environment
    55→SIGNING_IDENTITY="${SIGNING_IDENTITY:-}"
    56→APPLE_ID="${APPLE_ID:-}"
    57→TEAM_ID="${TEAM_ID:-}"
    58→APP_PASSWORD="${APP_PASSWORD:-}"
    59→NOTARIZE=true
    60→INPUT_PKG=""
    61→OUTPUT_PKG=""
    62→
    63→# Logging functions
    64→log_info() {
    65→    echo -e "${BLUE}[INFO]${NC} $1"
    66→}
    67→
    68→log_success() {

#!/bin/bash
# =============================================================================
# SPLICE PKG Signing and Notarization Script
# =============================================================================
# This script signs a macOS PKG installer with Developer ID Installer certificate
# and submits it to Apple's notary service for notarization.
#
# Prerequisites:
#   - Developer ID Installer certificate installed in Keychain
#   - Apple ID with App-Specific Password for notarization
#   - xcrun notarytool (macOS 12+) or altool (legacy)
#
# Usage:
#   ./sign-and-notarize.sh [options] <unsigned-pkg>
#
# Options:
#   --identity    Certificate identity (default: auto-detect)
#   --apple-id    Apple ID email for notarization
#   --team-id     Apple Developer Team ID
#   --password    App-specific password (or @keychain:name)
#   --no-notarize Skip notarization (signing only)
#   --output      Output path for signed PKG
#   --help        Show this help message
#
# Environment Variables (alternative to options):
#   SIGNING_IDENTITY  - Certificate identity
#   APPLE_ID          - Apple ID email
#   TEAM_ID           - Apple Developer Team ID  
#   APP_PASSWORD      - App-specific password
#
# Example:
#   ./sign-and-notarize.sh \
#     --identity "Developer ID Installer: Your Company (TEAM_ID)" \
#     --apple-id "your@email.com" \
#     --team-id "TEAM_ID" \
#     --password "@keychain:AC_PASSWORD" \
#     dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg
# =============================================================================

set -e  # Exit on error

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/../.." && pwd)"

# Default values from environment
SIGNING_IDENTITY="${SIGNING_IDENTITY:-}"
APPLE_ID="${APPLE_ID:-}"
TEAM_ID="${TEAM_ID:-}"
APP_PASSWORD="${APP_PASSWORD:-}"
NOTARIZE=true
INPUT_PKG=""
OUTPUT_PKG=""

# Logging functions
log_info() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[INFO]${NC} $1"
}

log_success() {
    echo -e "${GREEN}[SUCCESS]${NC} $1"
}

log_warning() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARNING]${NC} $1"
}

log_error() {
    echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"
}

# Show help
show_help() {
    head -50 "$0" | grep "^#" | sed 's/^# //' | sed 's/^#//'
    exit 0
}

# Parse command line arguments
parse_args() {
    while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
        case $1 in
            --identity)
                SIGNING_IDENTITY="$2"
                shift 2
                ;;
            --apple-id)
                APPLE_ID="$2"
                shift 2
                ;;
            --team-id)
                TEAM_ID="$2"
                shift 2
                ;;
            --password)
                APP_PASSWORD="$2"
                shift 2
                ;;
            --no-notarize)
                NOTARIZE=false
                shift
                ;;
            --output)
                OUTPUT_PKG="$2"
                shift 2
                ;;
            --help|-h)
                show_help
                ;;
            -*)
                log_error "Unknown option: $1"
                exit 1
                ;;
            *)
                INPUT_PKG="$1"
                shift
                ;;
        esac
    done
}

# Find Developer ID Installer certificate
find_signing_identity() {
    if [[ -n "$SIGNING_IDENTITY" ]]; then
        log_info "Using specified signing identity: $SIGNING_IDENTITY"
        return
    fi
    
    log_info "Searching for Developer ID Installer certificate..."
    
    # Search for Developer ID Installer certificates
    IDENTITIES=$(security find-identity -v -p basic 2>/dev/null | grep "Developer ID Installer" || true)
    
    if [[ -z "$IDENTITIES" ]]; then
        log_error "No 'Developer ID Installer' certificate found in Keychain!"
        echo ""
        echo "To create a Developer ID Installer certificate:"
        echo "1. Open Keychain Access"
        echo "2. Go to: Keychain Access → Certificate Assistant → Request a Certificate From a Certificate Authority"
        echo "3. Save the CSR file to disk"
        echo "4. Go to: https://developer.apple.com/account/resources/certificates/list"
        echo "5. Click '+' to create a new certificate"
        echo "6. Select 'Developer ID Installer' (NOT Developer ID Application)"
        echo "7. Upload your CSR file"
        echo "8. Download and double-click to install the certificate"
        echo ""
        echo "See: installer/macos/create-app-specific-password.md for detailed instructions"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Extract the first certificate
    SIGNING_IDENTITY=$(echo "$IDENTITIES" | head -1 | sed 's/.*"\(.*\)"/\1/')
    log_success "Found signing identity: $SIGNING_IDENTITY"
}

# Verify input PKG exists
verify_input() {
    if [[ -z "$INPUT_PKG" ]]; then
        log_error "No input PKG file specified!"
        echo "Usage: $0 [options] <unsigned-pkg>"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    if [[ ! -f "$INPUT_PKG" ]]; then
        log_error "Input PKG file not found: $INPUT_PKG"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    log_info "Input PKG: $INPUT_PKG"
    
    # Set output path if not specified
    if [[ -z "$OUTPUT_PKG" ]]; then
        BASENAME=$(basename "$INPUT_PKG" .pkg)
        DIRNAME=$(dirname "$INPUT_PKG")
        OUTPUT_PKG="${DIRNAME}/${BASENAME}-signed.pkg"
    fi
    
    log_info "Output PKG: $OUTPUT_PKG"
}

# Sign the PKG
sign_pkg() {
    log_info "Signing PKG with productsign..."
    
    # Remove existing signed PKG if it exists
    if [[ -f "$OUTPUT_PKG" ]]; then
        rm "$OUTPUT_PKG"
    fi
    
    # Sign with productsign
    productsign --sign "$SIGNING_IDENTITY" "$INPUT_PKG" "$OUTPUT_PKG"
    
    if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
        log_success "PKG signed successfully!"
    else
        log_error "Failed to sign PKG"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Verify signature
    log_info "Verifying signature..."
    pkgutil --check-signature "$OUTPUT_PKG"
    
    if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
        log_success "Signature verified!"
    else
        log_error "Signature verification failed!"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Notarize the PKG
notarize_pkg() {
    if [[ "$NOTARIZE" != "true" ]]; then
        log_warning "Skipping notarization (--no-notarize specified)"
        return
    fi
    
    # Check required credentials
    if [[ -z "$APPLE_ID" ]]; then
        log_error "Apple ID not specified! Use --apple-id or set APPLE_ID environment variable"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    if [[ -z "$TEAM_ID" ]]; then
        log_error "Team ID not specified! Use --team-id or set TEAM_ID environment variable"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    if [[ -z "$APP_PASSWORD" ]]; then
        log_error "App-specific password not specified! Use --password or set APP_PASSWORD environment variable"
        echo ""
        echo "See: installer/macos/create-app-specific-password.md for instructions"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    log_info "Submitting to Apple notary service..."
    log_info "This may take several minutes..."
    
    # Submit for notarization using notarytool (macOS 12+)
    if xcrun notarytool --version &>/dev/null; then
        # Use notarytool (preferred, macOS 12+)
        SUBMISSION_OUTPUT=$(xcrun notarytool submit "$OUTPUT_PKG" \
            --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
            --team-id "$TEAM_ID" \
            --password "$APP_PASSWORD" \
            --wait 2>&1)
        
        echo "$SUBMISSION_OUTPUT"
        
        # Check if successful
        if echo "$SUBMISSION_OUTPUT" | grep -q "status: Accepted"; then
            log_success "Notarization successful!"
        else
            log_error "Notarization failed!"
            
            # Try to get the log
            SUBMISSION_ID=$(echo "$SUBMISSION_OUTPUT" | grep "id:" | head -1 | awk '{print $2}')
            if [[ -n "$SUBMISSION_ID" ]]; then
                log_info "Fetching notarization log..."
                xcrun notarytool log "$SUBMISSION_ID" \
                    --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
                    --team-id "$TEAM_ID" \
                    --password "$APP_PASSWORD"
            fi
            exit 1
        fi
    else
        # Fall back to altool (legacy)
        log_warning "notarytool not found, using altool (legacy)..."
        
        xcrun altool --notarize-app \
            --primary-bundle-id "com.splice.installer" \
            --username "$APPLE_ID" \
            --password "$APP_PASSWORD" \
            --team-id "$TEAM_ID" \
            --file "$OUTPUT_PKG"
        
        log_warning "Notarization submitted. Check status manually with:"
        echo "  xcrun altool --notarization-history 0 -u $APPLE_ID -p <password>"
    fi
}

# Staple the notarization ticket
staple_pkg() {
    if [[ "$NOTARIZE" != "true" ]]; then
        return
    fi
    
    log_info "Stapling notarization ticket to PKG..."
    
    xcrun stapler staple "$OUTPUT_PKG"
    
    if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
        log_success "Notarization ticket stapled successfully!"
    else
        log_error "Failed to staple notarization ticket"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Final verification
final_verification() {
    log_info "Performing final verification..."
    
    echo ""
    echo "=========================================="
    echo "PKG Signature Information:"
    echo "=========================================="
    pkgutil --check-signature "$OUTPUT_PKG"
    
    echo ""
    echo "=========================================="
    echo "Gatekeeper Assessment:"
    echo "=========================================="
    spctl --assess -vv --type install "$OUTPUT_PKG" 2>&1 || true
    
    echo ""
    log_success "All done!"
    echo ""
    echo "Signed PKG: $OUTPUT_PKG"
    echo ""
    echo "You can distribute this PKG. Users on macOS 10.15+ should be able to"
    echo "install it without any Gatekeeper warnings."
}

# Main execution
main() {
    echo ""
    echo "============================================="
    echo "  SPLICE PKG Signing and Notarization Tool  "
    echo "============================================="
    echo ""
    
    parse_args "$@"
    verify_input
    find_signing_identity
    sign_pkg
    notarize_pkg
    staple_pkg
    final_verification
}

# Run main
main "$@"

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<installer-gui-script minSpecVersion="2">
    <title>SPLICE - AI Video Editor</title>
    <organization>com.splice</organization>
    <domains enable_localSystem="true" enable_currentUserHome="false"/>
    
    <!-- Minimum OS version -->
    <os-version min="10.14"/>
    
    <!-- Require admin for system-wide installation -->
    <options require-scripts="true" customize="never" rootVolumeOnly="true" hostArchitectures="x86_64,arm64"/>
    
    <!-- Background image and styling -->
    <background file="background.png" alignment="bottomleft" scaling="none"/>
    <background-darkAqua file="background-dark.png" alignment="bottomleft" scaling="none"/>
    
    <!-- Welcome screen -->
    <welcome file="welcome.html" mime-type="text/html"/>
    
    <!-- License agreement -->
    <license file="license.html" mime-type="text/html"/>
    
    <!-- Readme/Introduction -->
    <readme file="readme.html" mime-type="text/html"/>
    
    <!-- Conclusion screen -->
    <conclusion file="conclusion.html" mime-type="text/html"/>
    
    <!-- Installation check script -->
    <installation-check script="installCheck()"/>
    <script>
    function installCheck() {
        // Check if Adobe Premiere Pro is running
        if (system.run('/bin/bash', '-c', 'pgrep -x "Adobe Premiere Pro"') == 0) {
            my.result.title = 'Adobe Premiere Pro is Running';
            my.result.message = 'Please close Adobe Premiere Pro before installing SPLICE.';
            my.result.type = 'Fatal';
            return false;
        }
        return true;
    }
    </script>
    
    <!-- Volume check script -->
    <volume-check script="volumeCheck()"/>
    <script>
    function volumeCheck() {
        // Require at least 50MB free space
        if (my.target.availableKilobytes < 51200) {
            my.result.title = 'Insufficient Disk Space';
            my.result.message = 'SPLICE requires at least 50MB of free disk space.';
            my.result.type = 'Fatal';
            return false;
        }
        return true;
    }
    </script>
    
    <!-- Choices outline - defines what appears in installer -->
    <choices-outline>
        <line choice="splice-cep"/>
        <line choice="splice-uxp"/>
    </choices-outline>
    
    <!-- CEP Extension choice (always installed) -->
    <choice id="splice-cep" 
            title="SPLICE CEP Extension" 
            description="Required extension for Premiere Pro 14.0 - 24.x"
            visible="false"
            enabled="true"
            selected="true">
        <pkg-ref id="com.splice.panel.cep"/>
    </choice>
    
    <!-- UXP Plugin choice (always installed) -->
    <choice id="splice-uxp" 
            title="SPLICE UXP Plugin" 
            description="Enhanced plugin for Premiere Pro 25.0+"
            visible="false"
            enabled="true"
            selected="true">
        <pkg-ref id="com.splice.panel.uxp"/>
    </choice>
    
    <!-- Package references -->
    <pkg-ref id="com.splice.panel.cep"
             version="{{VERSION}}"
             installKBytes="10240"
             auth="Root"
             onConclusion="None">
        #splice-cep.pkg
    </pkg-ref>
    
    <pkg-ref id="com.splice.panel.uxp"
             version="{{VERSION}}"
             installKBytes="5120"
             auth="Root"
             onConclusion="None">
        #splice-uxp.pkg
    </pkg-ref>
    
</installer-gui-script>

file.content:
#!/bin/bash
#
# SPLICE CEP Panel - ZXP Package Builder
# Creates a .zxp package from CEP panel source
#
# ZXP is Adobe's signed package format for CEP extensions
#

set -e

# Script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/../.." && pwd)"
INSTALLER_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/.."

# Source and output paths
CEP_SOURCE="$PROJECT_ROOT/splice-cep"
OUTPUT_DIR="$INSTALLER_DIR/shared"
BUILD_TEMP="$INSTALLER_DIR/build/zxp-temp"

# Version info
VERSION_FILE="$INSTALLER_DIR/shared/version.json"
if [ -f "$VERSION_FILE" ]; then
    VERSION=$(grep -o '"version"[[:space:]]*:[[:space:]]*"[^"]*"' "$VERSION_FILE" | cut -d'"' -f4)
else
    VERSION="6.0.3"
fi

# Output filename
ZXP_OUTPUT="$OUTPUT_DIR/splice-cep.zxp"

# Colors
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
NC='\033[0m'

log_info() {
    echo -e "${GREEN}[INFO]${NC} $1"
}

log_warn() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARN]${NC} $1"
}

log_error() {
    echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"
}

# Check requirements
check_requirements() {
    if [ ! -d "$CEP_SOURCE" ]; then
        log_error "CEP panel source not found: $CEP_SOURCE"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    if [ ! -f "$CEP_SOURCE/CSXS/manifest.xml" ]; then
        log_error "CEP manifest.xml not found"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    if ! command -v zip &> /dev/null; then
        log_error "zip command not found. Please install zip utility."
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Clean up previous builds
cleanup() {
    log_info "Cleaning up previous build artifacts..."
    rm -rf "$BUILD_TEMP"
    rm -f "$ZXP_OUTPUT"
    mkdir -p "$BUILD_TEMP"
    mkdir -p "$OUTPUT_DIR"
}

# Copy and prepare files
prepare_files() {
    log_info "Preparing CEP panel files..."
    
    # Copy all CEP files
    cp -R "$CEP_SOURCE"/* "$BUILD_TEMP/"
    
    # Remove development files
    rm -rf "$BUILD_TEMP/.git" 2>/dev/null || true
    rm -rf "$BUILD_TEMP/node_modules" 2>/dev/null || true
    rm -f "$BUILD_TEMP/.gitignore" 2>/dev/null || true
    rm -f "$BUILD_TEMP/.DS_Store" 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Remove any test files
    rm -rf "$BUILD_TEMP/tests" 2>/dev/null || true
    rm -rf "$BUILD_TEMP/test" 2>/dev/null || true
    rm -rf "$BUILD_TEMP/__tests__" 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Update version in manifest if needed
    if [ -f "$BUILD_TEMP/CSXS/manifest.xml" ]; then
        # macOS sed syntax
        if [[ "$OSTYPE" == "darwin"* ]]; then
            sed -i '' "s/ExtensionBundleVersion=\"[^\"]*\"/ExtensionBundleVersion=\"$VERSION\"/" "$BUILD_TEMP/CSXS/manifest.xml"
        else
            sed -i "s/ExtensionBundleVersion=\"[^\"]*\"/ExtensionBundleVersion=\"$VERSION\"/" "$BUILD_TEMP/CSXS/manifest.xml"
        fi
    fi
    
    log_info "Files prepared"
}

# Create ZXP package (unsigned for development)
create_zxp() {
    log_info "Creating ZXP package..."
    
    pushd "$BUILD_TEMP" > /dev/null
    
    # Create ZXP (ZIP) file
    # Note: For production, this should be signed using ZXPSignCmd
    zip -r "$ZXP_OUTPUT" . \
        -x "*.DS_Store" \
        -x "__MACOSX/*" \
        -x "*.git*" \
        -x "node_modules/*" \
        -x "*.map" \
        -x "*.log"
    
    popd > /dev/null
    
    # Verify ZXP was created
    if [ ! -f "$ZXP_OUTPUT" ]; then
        log_error "ZXP package was not created"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Show file info
    local size=$(du -h "$ZXP_OUTPUT" | cut -f1)
    log_info "ZXP package created: $ZXP_OUTPUT ($size)"
}

# Verify ZXP package
verify_zxp() {
    log_info "Verifying ZXP package..."
    
    # List contents
    unzip -l "$ZXP_OUTPUT" | head -20
    
    # Verify manifest.xml is at root
    if ! unzip -l "$ZXP_OUTPUT" | grep -q "CSXS/manifest.xml"; then
        log_error "CSXS/manifest.xml not found in ZXP package"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Verify AccessList was added
    if ! unzip -p "$ZXP_OUTPUT" "CSXS/manifest.xml" | grep -q "AccessList"; then
        log_warn "AccessList not found in manifest - network permissions may be missing!"
    else
        log_info "AccessList found in manifest - network permissions included"
    fi
    
    log_info "ZXP package verification passed"
}

# Cleanup temporary files
final_cleanup() {
    log_info "Cleaning up temporary files..."
    rm -rf "$BUILD_TEMP"
}

# Main
main() {
    echo ""
    echo "========================================"
    echo "SPLICE CEP ZXP Package Builder"
    echo "Version: $VERSION"
    echo "========================================"
    echo ""
    
    check_requirements
    cleanup
    prepare_files
    create_zxp
    verify_zxp
    final_cleanup
    
    echo ""
    echo "========================================"
    log_info "ZXP package build complete!"
    echo "Output: $ZXP_OUTPUT"
    echo "========================================"
    echo ""
    echo "NOTE: For production, sign the ZXP using ZXPSignCmd"
    echo "      For development, you can install unsigned ZXP directly"
    echo "========================================"
}

main "$@"

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ExtensionManifest xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
                   ExtensionBundleId="com.splice.panel"
                   ExtensionBundleVersion="6.0.8"
                   Version="12.0">

    <ExtensionList>
        <Extension Id="com.splice.panel.main" Version="6.0.8"/>
    </ExtensionList>

    <ExecutionEnvironment>
        <HostList>
            <!-- Support Premiere Pro 2023 (v23) through 2026+ -->
            <Host Name="PPRO" Version="[23.0,99.9]"/>
        </HostList>
        <LocaleList>
            <Locale Code="All"/>
        </LocaleList>
        <RequiredRuntimeList>
            <!-- Support multiple CEP versions for broader compatibility -->
            <RequiredRuntime Name="CSXS" Version="10.0"/>
            <RequiredRuntime Name="CSXS" Version="11.0"/>
            <RequiredRuntime Name="CSXS" Version="12.0"/>
        </RequiredRuntimeList>
    </ExecutionEnvironment>

    <DispatchInfoList>
        <Extension Id="com.splice.panel.main">
            <DispatchInfo>
                <Resources>
                    <MainPath>./panel/index.html</MainPath>
                    <ScriptPath>./jsx/hostScript.jsx</ScriptPath>
                    <CEFCommandLine>
                        <!-- FireCut-style CEF flags for maximum compatibility -->
                        <Parameter>--allow-file-access</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--allow-file-access-from-files</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--enable-nodejs</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--mixed-context</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--disable-web-security</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--allow-running-insecure-content</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--allow-insecure-localhost</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--enable-local-file-accesses</Parameter>
                    </CEFCommandLine>
                </Resources>
                <AccessList>
                    <URLAccess>
                        <!-- Production API -->
                        <URL>https://splice-api-production.up.railway.app</URL>
                        <!-- Web domains -->

#!/bin/bash
#
# SPLICE Plugin - macOS Postinstall Script
# This script runs after the package files are installed
#

set -e

# Configuration
PLUGIN_NAME="com.splice.panel"
CEP_SOURCE="/tmp/splice-installer/cep"
UXP_CCX="/tmp/splice-installer/splice-uxp.ccx"
LOG_FILE="/tmp/splice-installer.log"

# Installation paths
CEP_SYSTEM_PATH="/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions"
CEP_USER_PATH="$HOME/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions"
UPIA_PATH="/Library/Application Support/Adobe/Adobe Desktop Common/RemoteComponents/UPI/UnifiedPluginInstallerAgent/UnifiedPluginInstallerAgent.app/Contents/MacOS/UnifiedPluginInstallerAgent"

# Logging function
log() {
    echo "$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') - $1" | tee -a "$LOG_FILE"
}

log "=== SPLICE Plugin Installation Started ==="

# Kill Premiere Pro if running (with user prompt would be handled by preflight check)
if pgrep -x "Adobe Premiere Pro" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    log "Premiere Pro is running. Attempting to close..."
    osascript -e 'tell application "Adobe Premiere Pro" to quit' 2>/dev/null || true
    sleep 2
fi

# Function to install CEP extension
install_cep() {
    log "Installing CEP extension..."
    
    # Try system-wide first (requires admin), fall back to user directory
    if [ -d "$CEP_SOURCE" ]; then
        TARGET_PATH="$CEP_SYSTEM_PATH/$PLUGIN_NAME"
        
        # Create the extensions directory if it doesn't exist
        mkdir -p "$CEP_SYSTEM_PATH" 2>/dev/null || true
        
        # Remove old installation if exists
        if [ -d "$TARGET_PATH" ]; then
            log "Removing previous CEP installation..."
            rm -rf "$TARGET_PATH"
        fi
        
        # Copy new extension
        log "Copying CEP extension to $TARGET_PATH..."
        cp -R "$CEP_SOURCE" "$TARGET_PATH"
        
        # Set permissions
        chmod -R 755 "$TARGET_PATH"
        
        log "CEP extension installed successfully"
    else
        log "WARNING: CEP source not found at $CEP_SOURCE"
    fi
}

# Function to install UXP plugin
install_uxp() {
    log "Installing UXP plugin..."
    
    if [ -f "$UXP_CCX" ]; then
        if [ -f "$UPIA_PATH" ]; then
            log "Using UnifiedPluginInstallerAgent to install UXP..."
            "$UPIA_PATH" --install "$UXP_CCX" 2>&1 | tee -a "$LOG_FILE" || {
                log "WARNING: UPIA installation failed, UXP may need manual installation"
            }
            log "UXP plugin installation attempted via UPIA"
        else
            log "WARNING: UnifiedPluginInstallerAgent not found at $UPIA_PATH"
            log "UXP plugin may need manual installation via Creative Cloud Desktop"
            
            # Copy CCX to user's Downloads for manual installation
            DOWNLOADS_PATH="$HOME/Downloads"
            if [ -d "$DOWNLOADS_PATH" ]; then
                cp "$UXP_CCX" "$DOWNLOADS_PATH/SPLICE-Plugin.ccx"
                log "CCX file copied to Downloads folder for manual installation"
            fi
        fi
    else
        log "No UXP plugin found at $UXP_CCX, skipping UXP installation"
    fi
}

# Function to enable CEP debug mode (required for extensions not from Adobe Exchange)
enable_debug_mode() {
    log "Enabling CEP debug mode for SPLICE extension..."
    # Enable for all CSXS versions (Premiere Pro 2020-2025+)
    defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.11 PlayerDebugMode 1 2>/dev/null || true
    defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.10 PlayerDebugMode 1 2>/dev/null || true
    defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.9 PlayerDebugMode 1 2>/dev/null || true
    defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.8 PlayerDebugMode 1 2>/dev/null || true
    log "CEP debug mode enabled for all Adobe CC versions"
}

# Function to cleanup temporary files
cleanup() {
    log "Cleaning up temporary files..."
    rm -rf /tmp/splice-installer 2>/dev/null || true
    log "Cleanup complete"
}

# Main installation sequence
main() {
    # Install CEP extension
    install_cep
    
    # Install UXP plugin
    install_uxp
    
    # Enable debug mode if requested
    enable_debug_mode
    
    # Cleanup
    cleanup
    
    log "=== SPLICE Plugin Installation Complete ==="
    log "Please restart Adobe Premiere Pro to use SPLICE"
    log ""
    log "Find SPLICE at:"
    log "  - Premiere Pro 14-24: Window > Extensions > SPLICE"
    log "  - Premiere Pro 25+: Window > UXP Plugins > SPLICE"
}

# Run main installation
main

exit 0

Welcome to SPLICE v6.0.3

CEP Extension for Adobe Premiere Pro 2025

SPLICE transforms your video editing workflow with intelligent automation, helping you cut editing time dramatically while achieving professional results.

What's Included

  • AI Silence Detection - Automatically remove awkward pauses
  • AI Music Generation - Create custom background music
  • Auto Chapter Markers - Smart scene and topic detection
  • Text-Based Editing - Edit your video by editing a transcript
  • Animated Captions - Instagram/TikTok style captions
  • Social Reframe - One-click vertical video conversion
  • Filler Word Detection - Remove "um", "uh", and more

Installation Details

  • Extension ID: com.splice.panel
  • Install location: /Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/

System Requirements

  • Adobe Premiere Pro 2025 (or CC 2019 and later)
  • macOS 10.14 (Mojave) or later
  • Internet connection for AI features

This installer will add the SPLICE CEP extension to your Adobe Premiere Pro installation. Please ensure Premiere Pro is closed before continuing.

file.content:
#!/bin/bash
#
# SPLICE Plugin - macOS Uninstaller Script
# Removes SPLICE extension from the system
#

set -e

# Colors
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m'

PLUGIN_NAME="com.splice.panel"
CEP_SYSTEM_PATH="/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/$PLUGIN_NAME"
CEP_USER_PATH="$HOME/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/$PLUGIN_NAME"
LOG_FILE="/tmp/splice-uninstall.log"

log() {
    echo "$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') - $1" | tee -a "$LOG_FILE"
}

echo ""
echo "========================================"
echo "SPLICE Uninstaller"
echo "========================================"
echo ""

# Confirm uninstallation
echo -e "${YELLOW}This will remove SPLICE from your system.${NC}"
read -p "Are you sure you want to continue? (y/n) " -n 1 -r
echo ""

if [[ ! $REPLY =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
    echo "Uninstallation cancelled."
    exit 0
fi

log "=== SPLICE Uninstallation Started ==="

# Check if Premiere Pro is running
if pgrep -x "Adobe Premiere Pro" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo ""
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Adobe Premiere Pro is running.${NC}"
    echo "Please close Premiere Pro before uninstalling."
    read -p "Press Enter when Premiere Pro is closed, or Ctrl+C to cancel..."
    
    if pgrep -x "Adobe Premiere Pro" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${RED}Premiere Pro is still running. Please close it manually.${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
fi

# Remove CEP extension from system path
if [ -d "$CEP_SYSTEM_PATH" ]; then
    log "Removing CEP extension from system path..."
    sudo rm -rf "$CEP_SYSTEM_PATH" && log "Removed: $CEP_SYSTEM_PATH" || log "Failed to remove: $CEP_SYSTEM_PATH"
fi

# Remove CEP extension from user path
if [ -d "$CEP_USER_PATH" ]; then
    log "Removing CEP extension from user path..."
    rm -rf "$CEP_USER_PATH" && log "Removed: $CEP_USER_PATH" || log "Failed to remove: $CEP_USER_PATH"
fi

# Attempt to uninstall UXP plugin via UPIA
UPIA_PATH="/Library/Application Support/Adobe/Adobe Desktop Common/RemoteComponents/UPI/UnifiedPluginInstallerAgent/UnifiedPluginInstallerAgent.app/Contents/MacOS/UnifiedPluginInstallerAgent"

if [ -f "$UPIA_PATH" ]; then
    log "Attempting to uninstall UXP plugin..."
    "$UPIA_PATH" --uninstall "$PLUGIN_NAME" 2>&1 | tee -a "$LOG_FILE" || {
        log "Note: UXP uninstallation via UPIA may have failed. Manual removal may be needed."
    }
fi

# Remove SPLICE application folder if it exists
if [ -d "/Applications/SPLICE" ]; then
    log "Removing SPLICE application folder..."
    rm -rf "/Applications/SPLICE"
fi

# Clean up any preferences
log "Cleaning up preferences..."
defaults delete com.splice.panel 2>/dev/null || true

# Remove CEP debug mode settings that were set for SPLICE
# Note: We don't remove these as they might be needed for other extensions

# Clean up temporary files
rm -rf /tmp/splice-installer 2>/dev/null || true

log "=== SPLICE Uninstallation Complete ==="

echo ""
echo -e "${GREEN}========================================"
echo "SPLICE has been uninstalled successfully."
echo "========================================${NC}"
echo ""
echo "Note: If you had UXP plugins installed, you may need to"
echo "remove them manually via Creative Cloud Desktop app."
echo ""
echo "Log file saved to: $LOG_FILE"
echo ""

exit 0
